alert.note: Alert for La Paz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 19 at 11:58AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST/545 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arizona, including the following county, La Paz. Portions of southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST /545 PM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Highway 72 in central La Paz County has been closed due to flooding across the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 AM MST /1154 AM PDT/, radar continues to show persistent light to moderate rainfall across the area with rainfall rates upwards of 0.25 to 0.50 inches per hour at times. Flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area through this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parker, Quartzsite, Bouse and Poston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
